description:
Bartender!!! Can I get a Sidecar. He replies, wow! I haven't made one of those in 20 years. This my go to neighborhood bar, when I could getaway. Hands down this Saloon is like Cheers, and even better. Where everyone knows your name, and a shake a hand meet a friend.

Ended up order 4 and an IPA. Very reasonable prices, and always always have a mature crowd.
author: Charlotte T.

description:
Since my girlfriend and I never hang out in the Dogpatch / Potrero Hill area, we decided to check out one more bar before heading home. We walked over to Blooms Saloon on Wednesday, June 20th and arrived around 8pm.

After having cocktails and whisky, I decided to switch it up to beer. Got a Stella Artois while my gf got a chardonnay. I believe it was a Joel Gott 2014. (Don't ask me how I know that. I honestly have no idea.) I paid for the first round, so from recollection, I think both drinks were $14. We ended up sitting down at a giant plush booth. Felt kind of like VIP status as I didn't see any other booths around. My gf ended up getting us a second round of the same drinks.

Vibe here is chill. Kinda divey, but in a huge space. It was dark where we were sitting, but I believe there's big windows in the back, so lots of light in that area of the bar. I think they have a back patio, but it seemed roped off that day, so we didn't explore.

The end of our time here was a little odd. When my gf came back after buying the second round, she asked me if I had any cash. When I asked why, she said the bartender seemed pissed we were ordering and paying by round instead of keeping a tab open. Maybe he was mad about the CC fees? It made us feel unwelcome, so we left after that second round.

Nice bar to just chill and drink. Too bad we had that weird experience with the bartender.
author: Elena N.

description: Laid back dive bar with a killer view of the city and Bay Bridge if you get a table right next to the window. The bartender was not welcoming though. It's also pretty far from...well, anything. I know a couple people who live in that area so I'll probably be back at some point, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to visit.
author: Victoria S.

description: Blooms is a bar my family has been visiting for a very long time. Cool bar in Potrero hill with an even cooler view of sf. I wish the back patio was more available but the neighbors are snivelers and complain. Drinks aren't too expensive and the bartenders are nice people. Also has a small pool table and darts.  Cool bar to check out while in sf.
author: Mark P.

description: This bar is so chillls and divey. Such a beautiful view of the city and not too noisy on a Friday night.
author: Connie C.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar. Plenty of TV screens (which makes it better than DP Saloon for watching a game by a factor of 10), great pool table, fabulous bartenders (bonus points for Holly, if she had more shifts we'd probably be here even MORE often), and great drinks at surprisingly un-SF prices.
author: Mike V.

description: This is a cool bar slightly off the beaten track. Good selection of beers and spirits and you can take a seat at the long bar. The view from the back is pretty cool!
author: Ada C.

description: Great neighborhood bar with an amazing view of the SF skyline. I have been coming here for years and the recent update in decore and bar staff is a pleasant upgrade. I will continue to cime for the great drinks and chill neighborhood environment. I would highly recommend.
author: Anthony R.

description:
This place is not worth your time.  When we walked in, the bartender was very cold and rude to my friend and I. He barely turned and grunted when trying to place our order. It was very apparent that he didn't want us there, but I grew up in this neighborhood and always wanted to give it a try, so we ordered a couple beers nevertheless. We drank them as fast as we could and left.

The place maybe had 4 other people there on a Thursday night so I don't understand why you would behave so rudely towards your few paying customers. As a kid, I saw Blooms as a cool neighborhood hangout, so I was very disappointed to feel unwelcome. Maybe as a young asian male, I didn't fit the profile of who would normally walk into this bar, but that really shouldn't matter. Or maybe the bartender was just in a bad mood. If your bartender is like this to everyone though, I'm surprised this place is still around.

Regardless, I will NEVER be going back. I've never had a problem at Dogpatch Saloon, so that's where I will be getting my beers from now on.
author: Kameron C.

description: This is an awesome neighborhood pub!    It has awesome taps.    The bartenders are friendly and know how to make tasty drinks.   They have a pool table for customers wanting to have some fun.   They also have a photo booth near the back of the bar.   It did eat our money, but the bartender refunded us the amount lost.    It also has a lovely view of the city sky line!  If you happen to be in the area, I recommend stopping by for a drink!
author: William G.

description: This is a neat little neighborhood dive bar with an amazing view of the city and the Bay Bridge. The staff here is always very friendly, and most of the patrons here are other folks who live in the neighborhood. The draft beer list is pretty underwhelming, especially with so much local craft beer booming in the area. It would be great for this place to update their taps. We like to come to Blooms because it is a lot less pretentious than a few of the other similar places at the bottom of the hill or in the Dogpatch. They also have our favorite classic pinball game Theatre of Magic, such a fun machine! Would recommend this spot for anyone who lives in the area, just make sure you bring quarters and cash!
author: Alex E.

description: We love the new decor, the dark wood is a huge improvement. What a great neighborhood spot! The back patio in the San Francisco summer will soon be epic.
author: Emily M.

description: This place has gotten a perfect little facelift! The little spruce up was just what this place needed. They are under new ownership and she is charming and welcoming. Also really enjoyed hanging out with Chelsea. Would definitely come back!
author: paulina k.

description: The proprietor was a mean-sprited, verbally abusive, classist jerk to me for owning an RV and legally parking it near his bar.
author: Jay P.

description: Albert is the best bartender in the city. Enjoy the best views of the city and an excellent dart board.
author: Caitlin O.

description: I love this place! Everything a neighborhood bar should be. Great view of the city. The new owner is super friendly and is always entertaining.
author: Tommy W.

description:
This bar was cool until we ran into the wild bartender with ears down to her shoulders. My friends birthday was being celebrated and all was good until he put $2 in the juke box. Bartender decided music was killin her vibe or whatever and turned it off (with out warning) to whatever was on her iPod. When we inquired about a $2 refund it was a rudely denied request- to say it nicely. (Complaining commenced) 
When my friend came to us to vent about the rude customer service, she promptly scolded him, turning the music off, displaying her alpha dominance- making it known that it is "her bar right now" and if he wanted to continue "talking shit" we can see out selves out the door. 

In hindsight, I'm really not sure if this is a good bar to patronize. 

They have pinball.  :)
author: T D.

description:
Nigel, friday night bartender's customer review:
Great bunch of fools!
Dig our regs, even the hippies (Billy). 
Dig our new friends!
Warning: sometimes this place is packed with handsome men, beautiful women, and too much dancing
author: Alfred M.

description:
This bar gets a lot of light if you sit near the door. I'm not sure if they open up the patio to their guests. It's a typical dive bar that seems to be frequented by locals in the area. I know they gave us strange looks when a bunch of photographers stopped in and were thirsty from climbing the hills all day.

The bartender took it all in stride and served us all quickly and efficiently. I loved the old school phone booth inside.

Prices seemed reasonable for drinks.

I would stop by here if I were in the area again.
author: Amy J.

description:
This Rico guy. 

He should run for mayor. He's a man's man. He makes a Bloody Mary that's wakes the dead. Great tunes on the jukebox. It's a shame the neighbors are lame, and the outdoor patio is locked up, but still a great view of the city skyline. Not recommended for phonies: you will be exposed and humbled in a heartbeat. Be a decent, respectful, selfless human being, and this saloon will welcome you with open arms.
author: Garrett M.

description: Yup.  It is what it is.  A nice little neighborhood dive bar that serves great beer and not one shred of food. But (depending on the hour) you can walk across 18th Street to Hazel's Kitchen, get lunch, and watch the Warriors game on a Sunday afternoon with a dozen or so folks from the hood.  Or you can go to some BFD Sports Bar and watch the game smashed in between a few hundred of your closest friends, waiting a half hour to get the bartender's attention so you can get another beer.  (I'd rather go to Blooms.)
author: Steve C.

description:
Three words: 
Rico's 
Bloody 
Marys

Take note San Francisco bartenders, mixologists, whatever you wanna call yourself: this man knows how to make one helluva Bloody Mary. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blooms-saloon-san-francisco?select=D-z9VpA2odswm0O8Id6eMQ#i17pbspIPU4OI2gcR902ug)

Perfect for waiting out that ridiculous brunch line at Plow.

You're welcome.
author: Adena B.

description:
Met a friend here for a drink, and it rapidly turned into a whiskey tasting fest. Felt a little weird drinking non-beer during the Giants game, especially since that seemed to be what the other handful of patrons were there to do, but it was kind of awesome anyway. Seeing that we were in it to win it our bartender kept offering us free tastes of something we hadn't ordered (yet) from their decently sized whiskey selection.  As a note to myself and to anyone who values random strangers' opinions on Scotch, here are my tasting notes!

- Aberlour 10: sweet, less burn 
- Glenmorangie (10 yr I think): lighter, woodier than the Aberlour
- Oban 14: very smooth, a little "soapy."  (This one has come highly recommended from friends)
- Talisker 10: one of the three famous super smoky whiskies (with Lagavulin 16 and Laphroaig 10) this one was a little more "bacon-like" than others
- Lagavulin 16: smoother and woodier than the Talisker, this one also reminded me slightly more of the smell of gasoline too...
- Dahlwhinner 15: lighter in color, this one was a little soapy tasting also (like the Oban) and also had a honey flavor and taste
- Balvenie 14: darker in color, this one had a simpler and "thjinner" flavor"
- Macallan 12 (OK this wasn't at this bar, but I had it recently): sweet and chocolatey (which the label advertises as "vanilla." Great!
author: Aaron M.

description: Old bartender is a dick. Never come here. You won't be missing anything. I'd give a negative review  for no food if I could.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I love a good dive bar. I'll give Bloom's its pros: good beer on tap for a reasonable price, good jukebox with plenty of old tunes, pool and darts (darts is free, I think pool is too), laid-back blue-collar clientele who will talk sports. In short, you would think it's a great place to go with friends when you just want to have some beers and chill.

A great place to get beer, that is, if you can get beer. As many reviewers have noted, the bartenders here suck suck suckity suck. On one night I went (after being here multiple times before, mind you) the bartender Nigel was totally drunk. When my friend asked him how a shot of whiskey cost, he got pissed off (I can only assume he misunderstood) and started yelling about how "If you're going to have an attitude like that, you can leave." We tried to explain there must be a misunderstanding, and even a guy at the bar who had overheard the whole thing tried to calm Nigel down, but he had worked himself into quite a tizzy. We waited around a few minutes in the hopes he might calm down and listen to reason, but he just kept giving us stank-eye, tantrum-ing around, and occasionally saying something like "that's right!" to assert his dominance.

It sucks, because we'd been here at least four times and had made friends with some of the regulars who would play pool or darts. But the whole thing was so annoying that I refuse to go now.
author: Cody R.

description:
I've been to Bloom's before. Ok, nothing yelp-worthy. Until today.
My friend arranged with the owner to have his karaoke-themed birthday party there, except when the KJ showed up to set up, the bartender was incredibly rude, and said he didn't want to listen to his "shitty music" while the Giants game was on. So my friend had to CANCEL HIS OWN BIRTHDAY PARTY nine minutes before it started because the bartender was a total dick, and then he had to stay there to direct all the people he had invited to the park we had to move the party to. About an hour later, the owner had been contacted, the bartender had been chewed out and FINALLY offered to let us stay - after we'd already gone to the liquor store across the street to get our adult beverages to go. Too little, too late jackass. 
Never, ever, ever coming back to this place.
author: T P.

description: Best view in the city, a friendly REAL place. Good beer on tap and great people all around, I would highly recommend Blooms as the perfect place to unwind after a long day.
author: Mark J.

description: Pretty solid bar.  The beer selection is decent.  Would be a decent spot to meet up with folks.
author: Michael E.

description:
Me:  "I'd like a Dewars and soda."

Bartender:  "Now why would you want to ruin a good scotch like that?  If you're gonna order a scotch, then order it the right way.  If you want water, let your ice melt."

Both of us: big smiles and laughter.

That's how my first time at Blooms Saloon went down.  

The personable bartender then chatted with me about single malts as opposed to blends.  He is a scotch connoisseur.

Blooms is a friendly, comfortable place that offers great views of downtown from the back window.

Just be yourself and enjoy the place!
author: Thomas D.

description: Ridiculously strong cocktails, which can be a good thing and a bad thing. Relatively cheap for SF, and really one of just 2 bars in the neighborhood. It's got personality and a good staff.
author: Alison E.

description:
First and foremost, fantastic views of SF from their patio doors.  No, you can't sit on the patio, as far as I know.  But having those doors open on a hot summery day whilst you sip an afternoon away is heaven.  Trust.

Secondly, the bartender.   A great guy served up the joint on Saturday afternoon last after our crazy huge photowalk group came inside to cool off after a sweltering walk through Dogatch and Potrero.  One guy actually just asked for water, and the 'tender did a double take.  I was in a bar once where you get sprayed with the spigot when you asked for water.  Luckily for the gent, the 'tender was a kindly one and gave him a glass of the clear liquid without grumbling.  I hope the gent tipped him.

If I ever find myself back in the area, you know I'll be back.
author: Lorrayne L.

description: Terrible tattooed bar tender that spills your beer all over the place before serving and can't make a mixed drink for the life of her. This could be a great dive bar but you need to get better and friendlier bartenders... At least an attractive one. That one you have can scare all the customers away!
author: TJ U.

description: This is a great little neighborhood bar with a cool view and friendly bartenders. They also have a dart board which I am a huge fan of, and the strong drinks keep the atmosphere fun. Definitely worth a visit!!
author: Cori C.

description:
For a quick, unpretentious drink in the middle of Potrero Hill, you really can't beat a stiff cocktail at Blooms. It's easy - just like my first girlfriend. Whoa, sick burn!

They always have the Giants game (obvi when it's baseball season) on full torque. I can't say I've ever been to a bar that blasts audio from the game as loud as they do at Blooms. It's as if you're actually at the game! If you're a fan, you'll dig it.

Other than that, it's just a no frills type place where you can easily escape the day's weary battles. But only if you bring cash... no credit cards accepted here, sucka!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Very reasonable! !! Best in the Bay...Clean and well maintained.  Bartender has over 20 years with establishment.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I really want to like it here but don't seem welcomed since I'm not originally from Potrero Hill or a rough, old bantering man. It definitely has not been a friendly atmosphere, but I don't need it to be. I've stopped by multiple times and will probably continue to infrequently, being that I appreciate neighborhood bars that are low-key. 

The interior is fine and drinks are fine.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Great neighborhood bar unless Rico is working. Then it's paying for drinks from the biggest a-hole in Potrero Hill.
author: john k.

description: My company went on a morning trip to watch USA vs. Germany. There were at least six of us. I asked for water. The bartender stated I must pay and made it clear I was not welcome. I left.
author: Vladimir G.

description: A good place in Potrero Hills to grab a beer, watch sports, or play some pool and etc. The pool table is extremely small...But beer for $3.50 a pint? Sure! Anyways, stopped by here while waiting for some people to arrive in the nearby area.
author: Thanh T.

description: Blooms is the only normal bar in San Francisco.  Rico is a bartender of the old school.   If you don't like it don't go.  To bad someone bought it.  Thanks Rico for the memories.
author: Eric K.

description: Ok, given, it's 4th of July and we suspect perhaps the bartender is grumpy because he has to work - we will also partially credit that our bartender is also nearing his 'golden years' and maybe this is why he is so crotchety, but man, you are pissing your customers off with your rude and short fused demeanor! We actually walked out.
author: C. L.

description: The ATM here doesn't work for credit cards here. Not a big deal. What was a big deal was how the bartender became defensive, surly and mean and then swore at me when we asked him about the ATM. Completely uncalled for and put me in a terrible mood, I will not be coming back here ever again. I'm not talking, this is one of those bars where the bartenders are dicks and you just go with it, I'm talking about this guy was just a straight up asshole for no reason.
author: Amanda P.

description: Sundays with Kurt are amazing here! Great bartender started during NFL...if you want to watch sports in a local bar with a great peeps this is the place!
author: Eddie E.

description: Small bar, nice view out of the back window. Drinks are cheap and the bartender is friendly. Good place to stop in for a quick drink if your in the neighborhood.
author: Jake B.

description:
Came here on a recommendation from a friend who used to live around the corner.  Great neighborhood locals bar.  Cool bartender, cool place.  Drinks were fairly priced.
If I am in this area again, I will be here for sure.
author: Jason G.

description: A cozy dive bar with a little snobby old man bartender which I loved. Beer was so tasty, and I enjoyed watching TV and playing pool. One mystery is that the beer felt stronger and it took longer time to lower the blood alcohol. I will revisit whenever I need it.
author: Jay Y.

description: Great neighborhood bar in SF. One of the best places to grab a cold pint, watch Rico--arguably the last American hero--sling drinks and bust balls, and catch the Niners or Giants game.
author: Steve B.

description:
I've spent a lot of time here over the years. 

As long as you have half a sense of humor this is a place to be enjoyed with the diverse regulars. It's a neighborhood joint, pure and simple. Rico holds court and his friends come by...bikers, cops, ballpark guys and babes.. The regulars even take an annual trip to watch the Giants play in Chicago. Doesn't get much better than that. Except when the babes from Goathill bring us a pizza. So buy a couple of rounds and enjoy a slice of life with mostly native San Franciscans. Oh yeah... And should the tamale lady come through, buy twice what you think you should.

Great tunes, killer view. But if you don't care for a certain level of give and take, this may not be the best choice for you.

And Fred A.'s review pretty much says the rest.
author: Quail T.

description:
My ex boss used to live right the corner from here. He was the luckiest person on the planet.

It's a dive bar, but a dive bar with a spectacular view of the City. The beer is cheap and parking is a plentiful. I've taken clients, co workers, dates and friends to this spot and they are always impressed.
author: Rene C.

description: Been a few years since my review of Blooms, felt like it was time for an update. Well, still great. Great crowd every time, the guys working the bar are always super cool, the drinks are priced reasonably, what more could you want. A good time no matter if you're there for a Niners playoff game, a birthday gathering, or just stopping in for a drink or two.
author: Nick R.

description:
Nice bar, nice beer. Nothing particularly special, but a welcome addition to the hood. Friendly staff.

Beers not particulalry inspired - more standards: Sierra, Lagunitas, Anchor, Blue Moon, Stella Wifebeater. 

Generally quiet-ish-enough & that's a ll good.
author: Glen M.

description:
If you don't like Blooms.. you just don't get it... 
There are yuppie places all over the city that you would be much more comfortable in....
author: petaluma d.

description:
If you want a surly bartender that there to insult you more than to help you, this is the place.  

The good thing is that they are one of the only bars in Potrero/Mission that have several TVs and show sports.  They have the different packages so you can watch your home team play (even if they are the much-loathed Dallas Cowboys).  However, my experience sucked because of the bartender.  I got immediate gruff from him from the moment I walked in.  Then I had to keep moving because he kept changing the channel of the TV I was watching without even talking to me.  Whenever I asked about it he was even more of a jerk.  I don't plan on going back unless I'm feeling particularly masochistic.
author: Jim S.

description: Divey and very old school. You basically just order whiskey with a water back or be made fun of. I got crap for ordering a chilled Goose.
author: Freckles H.

description:
Juke box full of good music? Check.
Laid back, comfortable vibe? Check.
Monday night football on TV? Check.
Breathtaking view of the city out the back window? Check.
Stella Artois on tap? Check.

If this place were closer to home, I'd be a regular. For now I'll settle for coming here post-Eliza's.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Blooms is a great place to come to watch a game have a pint and get some attitude from the regulars and/or bartenders. It's their house and you are the guest, deal with it. Negative reviewers just can't deal with it but it cracks me up.

For example, the morning of the World Cup final a man walks in just to use the restroom. He asks the bartender if he can and the bartender surprisingly says sure. Man just stands there. Bartender says "Sh^t man, I'm not going to find it for you". Man reacted by saying a few swear words and walked out instead of just finding the bathroom himself. I think it's people like this who expect too much who just can't handle a place like this.
author: David H.

description: Such a cool spot, but service is terrible. Our bartender made us feel like a total imposition. Their hours say they open at 10am on Sunday but the bartender barked at us for trying to come in at 11:29 when he said they don't open until 11:30. Such a rude person.
author: Keara N.

description: I was a little afraid to walk in with the bikes outside, but it was 3-2 Giants vs. Braves and I HAD to see the end of the game.  It was a mob inside but the guys actually moved aside so that I could get up to the bar and order a beer, a friendly bartender took my order and two different guys hit on me!   Wow, this is a great bar and I'll be back!  Oh, and the Giants won!
author: Virginia T.

description:
Shafted!

Turned away from Bottom of the Hill because they were not open yet, what to do what to do.  W and I ended up at the local bar because the doors were wide open and quite inviting.  I miss hanging out in Portrero.......Farley's as well as Lingba.  *sigh*

W proceeded to order drinks at the bar when my sight fell upon two pinball machines up along the back wall.  I enjoy pool too, but at the moment, a couple had taken dominance over it.

The bartender is loud, funny and quite animated.  Not to mention very communicative.  He gave me a double take when I ordered a whiskey sour, which was atrociously strong.  I mentioned to W that not only was I having this on an empty stomach, but the drink was very strong so he'd probably have to end up finishing it off.

The first machine ate our quarters.  The second machine was much more receptive, but I was so clumsy with the paddles, that the game ended within ten minutes.  That darn Lethal Weapon Pinball machine!

Then, it was off to the golf machine that W had way more experience on.  I scored a +34 on an 18 hole game!  Woohoo!  So much for my being a hacker out on the real greens. UGH.

I had much fun here!  Partly because I was a little dizzy on the strong drink and the bar was cool as were the locals, who shared in singing along to the Eurythmics at the counter.  Plus, I was with good company, which was the icing on the cake.
author: Miika M.

description: This bar doesn't even deserve one star.  The bartender is rude, insulting, rambles and can't even take the time to listen to a customer.  Where can you have a job in this city where it is okay to give a customer the finger.  The owner should be ashamed, a legal liability waiting to happen.  I will never return nor will I suggest to others.
author: Pygmy S.

description: Not bad. Decent beer selection, great view out the window, cheap arcade games, pool and darts (though the two are kinda squished together and it's kind of awkward if there's a game of each going on concurrently.) I'd go here more often if I lived here, but since there's that dastardly hill involved, I'd sooner go somewhere nearer by to me. Doesn't affect the review though -- would love to have this place in SoMa along with the Chieftain.
author: Josh K.

description: I had a great time here once when I first moved to the neighborhood but then had a bad experience. We came in during a Warriors game and my boyfriend ordered himself a Lagunitas and me a diet coke (I was thirsty) and was given a Laguinitas and an Anchor Steam. My boyfriend explained it was a diet coke not an Anchor steam and the bartender said Well now you got an Anchor steam so pay up! A man at the bar tried to explain he heard Diet Coke too but the bartender just gave us some abuse about learning how to order drinks and made us pay for an extra beer anyways. I feel like anywhere else they would say oh sorry I misheard and we might even have just offered to pay anyways (we are British!) but he was so rude to us! Apparently we also ordered too slow we were told during his random rudeness about the mix up even though we would say one thing and he would just walk away from us, sooo kind of hard to order all at once like he seemed to want... If you had better more consistent service this would be a great bar. I am scared to go not sure if ending up here will ruin my night! I don't know why you can't just make the effort for your customers instead of just making it such an hit or miss place.
author: Bla B.

description:
I recently moved from Potrero Hill to the Pac Heights area.  Sad times because there is no bar like Blooms in the area.

Blooms Saloon is a classic dive bar.  Friday nights with Nigel are always fun with a great group of regulars and newbies.  A bit of abuse followed with a laugh and a game of pool is my idea of fun, so if you're sensitive, stay away.  Because truth be told, this crowd won't wantcha around.  But if you're thick skinned and can sling some zingers back to others, Blooms is your place.  After all... they treat you like any regular family would.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Dude, Blooms Saloon blows...the decor is so ridiculously hideous and mismatched, it has to be an inside joke.  

Their one saving grace *could* be the kick-ass patio I can see when  peer out the back doors...but apparently that only opens for one special football/BBQ/lame-excuse weekend? Never seen it happen and never heard a good excuse. 

On the plus side, there are plenty of creepy old dudes who hang out there and there is also this awesome dank, stale, drunk smell permeating the joint. If your curious, you don't have to go inside...take it in from the sidewalk.

There are way more deserving dive bars in the neighborhood to get your drink on....Parkside....Dogpatch....Yankee...
author: Elle N M.

description: pretty bogus  .... if the bartender didn't have his head up his butt maybe he'd have some customers
author: Kenneth M.

description: After going to Bloom's a few times now with co-workers I can honestly say  that I feel sorry that a cool little low key bar has been ruined by utterly terrible bartenders.  They are rude. They don't care. They ignore you standing at the bar even when  they've got nothing else going on. The evening guy the last time I was there over poured my Guinness and then poured off the remaining head leaving me with a glass that was about a 1/2 inch from full (headless). I'd prefer he just give me the finger and tell me to get out than do that. Thats just plain rude.
author: Matt C.

description:
It's a bar and no, they don't hold your hand while you drink you drink.  Just order you damn dirty martini and get a life.  We are not here to frickin entertain you. 

Yes, I love this place because some days after work, I don't want to be entertained.  Just make my drink and if conversations happens between me and you (bartender) ok but let's don't force it.  I know you prefer this anyways.

There's a pool table and great view out the back of the bar.  Good place after Goat Hill's pizza down the street.
author: anna l.

description:
Blooms is about two blocks from my house, where I've lived for almost four years, and I've only been inside it three times. 

This is a sore spot for me. I like to drink and I'm inherently lazy, so my neighborhood bars tend to snag a lot of my money, even if they kind of suck. But Bloom's sucks a whole lot, to the extent that on the rare occasions I want to get totally, horribly hammered, I go somewhere else, despite the obvious advantages of having a less than 2 minute walk home. And I don't ask a lot of bars when I want to do some serious drinking.

This place is sort of sad. Not to be all emotion-y, but it reminds me of some of my least favorite memories of the 'rents. It's full of people about the age that my father will always be, rocking out on their own to The Eagles and drunkenly discussing the comparative merits of bands whose times came and went before I snuck out the side of a condom and found me an egg. They "dance" to 70's rock, and by dance I mean grimace and air-guitar. Singularly depressing, a pocket of the crap atmospheres I left behind in Texas popped up in the middle of my granola-liberal SF dream.

My S.O. and I got yelled at for ordering an Irish Carbomb here. Are. You. Kidding. If there was a drink that efficient and tasty called the Jewish Occupation, I'd be actively encouraging my goyim friends to drink it. Sadly, all my people have is Passover wine, which tastes like a hangover. Better we should have carbombs, nu? But I digress.

The important thing to note here is that Bloom's sucks, which is sadder than saying that Random Sports Bar sucks because it continues to have this potential (right near me, not a sports bar, pool table, usually not too packed, poor lighting, contains alcohol) that it absolutely refuses to live up to. 

(Interesting anecdote: my S.O. recently discovered Craig's List Personals, specifically the erotic services section. She was looking up the Potrero Hill options, and kept calling me over- "Hey! That chick's always standing outside Bloom's! And so's that one!" And it was true.) 

You know what? I hate how negative this review is. I bet Bloom's has some totally positive aspects, like it's really well retrofitted or it used to have a detective agency on the top floor or something. Maybe it kicks ass on, like, Wednesdays around 11 am. A wise friend of mine once told me that you become what you hate, and he's right. I'm heading over to Bloom's right goddamned now for a beer, and I'm going to try as hard as I can to completely enjoy every minute of it. In fact, because I know I'm going to have such an amazingly positive bar experience, I'm going to go ahead and preemptively tack on a second star.
author: jason l.

description:
You've gotta love a dive with a view, an amazing juke box, a hilarious bartender with chutzpah, and a pool table to keep the friends entertained. 

Blooms keeps it simple for you: come here, drink, listen and enjoy the view!
author: Lorna M.

description:
I scanned down the existing reviews for Bloom's and it made me seethe with anger.  Really seethe.  Bloom's is a treasure for people who know how to drink and for people who appreciate what a real watering hole is.  I went here recently with a SFPD veteran who introduced me to the regulars.  Let's start with the bartender: Rico.

First of all Rico rocks.  He gave us two rounds free and then slammed down a bunch of whiskey shots with us.  Rico served in the Marines, and he has his priorities straight.  He understands what makes this city tick, but he also understands that what makes this city tick is not what makes this city run.  He likes people who make the city run: cops, DPW workers, bus drivers, custodians, and ex-Marines.  You should too.  If you don't, then go back to whining and work on your macrame messenger bag.  Rico hates your appletini drinking ass.  

The booze here is good solid booze: beer, whiskey, bourbon, and gin.  If you order a cocktail  make sure it is one of the old standbys.  Otherwise you deserve to be thrown off the back patio.  (Which has amazing views.)  There are no flavored vodkas here.  If you order a martini, it will be gin...because that's what is a martini is.  (This whole vodka thing is new...and it sucks.)  

As for the rest of the regulars, I won't say much more than they may be old and crotchtey because they have been dealing with unappreciative hippy wannabes for their entire careers.  For you neighborhood reviewers who complain about them, try buying them a beer and thanking them for making sacrifices and putting themselves in danger every time they went to work for thirty years.  I did.  You know what?  They were nice and thanked me for it.  

Go to Bloom's.  Buy copious amounts of booze.  Tip Rico well.  He deserves it.
author: Chris I.

description:
I can't tell if I love or hate this place...I think I love hating it.  If you are a 49's fan...this is your bar, all the season ticket holders drink here during the game instead of going to the stadium to watch their team suck more ass.

The owner (Rico?) is very rough around the edges.  Its a local bar, i.e. they don't take too well to strangers.  However, they have free hot dogs sometimes and that is a good thing.  Right?

I'm personally not going back unless I absolutely have to.  Its my 5th string back up sports bar.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Honestly folks, absolutely no reason to go here.  Such a waste of an awesome location that could be a really cool bar and place for the neighborhood to hang out, but NO.  Usually there are about 6 to 10 dudes hanging out, loud and unfriendly, much like a couple of the regular bar tenders.  Expect little to no service.  Dont expect any smiles or nice fun neighborly conversation.  Music in the jukebox sucks and is usually not on due to the sports being played on the TV.
I hope some day for a new owner.  I think this may be a cover up for some other business, because there's hardly anybody in there(for obvious reasons stated above)   I agree with Jason I, the other Yelper.
author: Jeff N.

description: Service is lacking - but great jukebox and view of the city.
author: Vicki L.

description: My friends and I happened upon this place while waiting for our table to open up across the street at Plow. Boy are we glad we did!  I've never enjoyed waiting for a table quite so thoroughly before. The bartender, who I believe is also the owner, was fun and a total sweetheart.  He made us the most delicious bloody marys.  The were so good in fact that we went back after brunch (despite being very full) for seconds.  I'll be back for more soon!
author: Dafna C.

description:
It all depends on what you like.

Do you like old people that look like they're still fighting in Vietnam that shout borderline racist shit at the TV screen when the Giants are playing?

Do you like your booze served with a giant side order of crotchety, dickish attitude?

Do you like the smell of cologne made in the 1950s?

In that case, you'll love Bloom's.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Rico's gruff but he's not a dick -- you need to earn his trust, prove you're not a frou-frou asshole with a Silicon Valley-bought $700k loft and a sweater-wearing chihuahua for a friend.

This is a throwback bar, from when Potrero was working-class. It's got a tough shell because it's seen SF change, it's seen SF move away, and it's seen SF become something else since it opened -- in the late 1930s. There's some history for ya.

They won't welcome you with open arms if you're an outsider, but if you act right and be real you'll find a nice place to drink. View, pool, darts -- yeah, they have all that, too.
author: Chris R.

description:
We had to stop by here after the delights of Chez Maman across the street - this is a delightful little neighborhood, and you know I can never resist a dive bar. 

But I was not quite sure what to expect - as I commented as we walked up, "I hope they have good music - good music maketh the bar!". 

The music was lame - I don't even remember what it was. Our presence swelled the numbers to less than a dozen and the evening seemed to have hit a low point. 

This is a definite neighborhood bar. Everyone seemed to know each other ('cept for us), Giants memorabilia adorned the walls, and genuine HD-sports on the ample windscreen TVs. 

As we supped out Anchor Steam (had to - this joint is about 400 yards from the brewery), started to warm to this place. Pool in the back - a great-looking (closed) deck with a fine downtown view - sports Sugar Bowl on the TV - Nothing special... noticed that the whisky selection was pretty basic too - not too many top-shelf choices here - Maker, JD, Walkers, etc. 

It was OK, but still could not put my finger on it. - what is this place - is this all it ahd to offer - where was the vibe? ..Until - yes - it's all in the music! 

Some clever person put on "Sex Machine" (Get Up!) and soon, up and down the bar, hips were movin' - next up was "Open Arms" (Oh Yes!), heads were nodding and lips were syncing - and to top it off, the one and only "Freebird" - guitars were airing! 

NOW I geddit! Sports, pool, good steady liquor, and down-to-earth rock and rock. This is not just a dive, not just a neighborhood joint, but your down to earth All-American BAR! On sh*t-kicking Portrero Hill, no less!

We had to leave on a good note - so we downed our Anchors and left while the going was good, I will be back.
author: Kingpin X.

description: One of the best neighborhood bars EVER!  No frills. Just your general crazy, loopy, but oh-so-entertaining and endearing bartender with a crotchety i've-seen-things-you-could-only-dream-about sorta attitude with a rag tag clientele. Love it.
author: Veronica H.

description:
I just mentioned this place on a thread about bars with great views, so here is my two cents:

GREAT VIEW.  This place is generally not crowded, and you can sit by the window and look directly at downtown SF.  Very nice.

Great bar.

Great Jukebox.  

This is just a great neighborhood bar.  Very unpretentious and just plain comfortable.  There is a pool table as well.  

Best moment I've had there included about 8 people standing around the pool table singing along with Hank Williams at the top of their lungs.  I wonder if Hank would have appreciated a bunch of overeducated chumps screaming along with his Greatest Hits package.

Do you think Hank ever even heard of a "Greatest Hits Package?"

Me either.  Ignorance is bliss.
author: Nelson W.

description: No way I can complain about this place. It's just a few blocks from Bottom of the Hill so it's a great location to meet up for pre-concert drinks. Prices are good and the beer selection (Sierra Nevada, Stella, Bass, PBR, Fat Tire, Anchor Steam, all on tap!) is even better. There is a (mini!) pool table, a jukebox with sweet  tunes, and pinball machines! The bartender was pleasant, the regulars were...quirky...and two different baseball (!) games were playing. Tops.
author: Natalye R.

description:
Blooms is a great neighborhood dive bar.  If I am in the City, or passing through on the way to or from SFO, I always stop in, as do many of my friends.  The drinks are good.  The stories are good.  The regulars are happy to see you, even if you only make it in a couple of times a year.  Rico, the usual bartender, is great - especially when he jams up idiots who stand there and want to watch the game for free while their laundry tumbles dry next door.  Or, when someone walks in, uses the can, and then tries to walk out without buying or saying anything.  

Rico, with a pad and pen - "Hey, pal, what's your address?  
Idiot - "What, excuse me?"
Rico - Your address.  What's your address?"
Idiot - "Sir, I just wanted to use the bathroom. I... I..."
Rico - "What's your address?  I'm going to come over to your house right about dinner time, walk in, and drop a chop in your toilet, and then walk out.  What's your address?"
Idiot - "I... I..."
Rico - "Next time, buy something.  Or ask permission.  This isn't a f*ckin public toilet, pal."

If you are lucky, you will be there when one of those two things happens.  It's cheaper than catching a show downtown, and the entertainment is better.
author: Mike S.

description: OK yelpers let me lay it out there-  Ill never be Yelp elite-- why? because I only tend to jump on here when Ive encountered something extraordinarily good or extraordinarily bad-  my experience at Bloom's falls into the latter category.  If you plan on going there bring a baseball bat-  no not to celebrate the spirit of baseball while you cheer on the Giants-  no bring a bat to defend yourself against the floridly psychotic Sunday morning bartender- an angry disgruntled man who chased me out of the bar when I asked what channel a particular ball game was on. (No I am not exaggerating)  Look, I get it, everyone has bad days.  But this guy was over the top scary and rude. Do yourself a favor and find another venue if this guy is working  unless of course you enjoy being treated like a p.o.s.
author: David d.

description:
Do you ever go somewhere and feel like it's missing something but you can't quite put your finger on it? That's pretty much my feeling about Blooms.

If I lived in the neighborhood, I would probably hang out from time to time to play darts and have a drink, but outside of walking distance there's not much about it that would compel me to go here. It's your standard neighborhood dive. 

The bartenders are always friendly and don't mind if you bring food in. They have the standard pool and darts. I tried Blackberry Stoli here for the first time. I enjoy that they have that available. 

Other than that? Meh. It seems like there are probably a lot of sports fans who come here and I assume it could be a fun spot for people who are into that sort of thing (especially Giants fans). 

The art on the wall is random in that "leftover from the garage sale" kind of way. They have an autographed photo of Keanu Reeves framed and bolted to the wall near a faded print of a zebra.

 It's a bit odd. It's a little lacking. It's just ok.
author: Kat E.

description: Nice bar used to have a urinal troft running around the bar from the 1800's (its not operational now you must use bathroom unless you want to get kicked out)  lots of parking
author: Ken M.

description: Too bad the only bar on top of the hill has such a horrible, rude staff. I would definitely NOT recommend this bar to anyone. Unless of course you like being berated by some of the grumpiest people I've ever met.
author: Keith C.

description: Cozy neighborhood sports bar with key local brews on tap.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I have been walking my dog past this place for months now, not paying any attention to it. 
(Perhaps it was because right next door of this place is a laundromat with a killer chihuahua that is always trying to attack my pit bull)
But anyways, I digress.....

We came across this place on Friday night and decided to stop by. What a cool place! Not a swanky place, by any means, but a cute dive kind of a bar with a cool patio in the very back.
author: Christine S.

description: There was nothing impressive about this bar. Played some darts, almost slipped on a spilled drink, sat in uncomfortably high chair...
author: Lidia Z.

description: I have two interactions with this bar.  Once, I called to see if they were showing a particular college football game on their television screens.  They bartender says "we hate that team" then hung up on me.  The second time, I met a few friends there and we all agreed it was some of the worst service we had ever received.  We waited forever for the bartender to stop chatting with the regulars and then seemed to be bothered by us wanting to order a round a beers.   Some customer service training would go along way!!!
author: Brock T.

description: This place is such a great little neighborhood dive bar.  The drinks are good, the people are real, and the bartenders are nothing short of exactly what you want.  If you're in Potrero Hill and want a few drinks after work, this spot is it.
author: Andy S.

description:
great neighborhood bar.

pool table. pinball. friendly bartenders. guiness on tap.  stumbliing distance from my (old) house!!

oh, and a killer view out their back windows/patio if downtown isn't fogged in.
author: Andrew C.

description:
My favorite thing about Bloom's isn't the view (which is great, but moreso when it's still light out and the cooler bartenders let you sit on the patio, even though their 'permit' doesn't allow it), but the jukebox. 

It's not the best jukebox in town, but it's got a great mix of classics with bits and pieces of modernity thrown in. It's perfect for playing Jukebox Bingo, a game of my own invention which involves 2 $5 bills, many drinks, and a story about each song played -- a great way to get to know someone, or rediscover why you like them in the first place.

Finally, it's probably the only bar in town where an Irish Coffee or Bailey's and Coffee will be made with Farley's best brew (from across the street). True, you might have to hike across the street, but the friendly bartenders will appreciate a hot cup of joe and you'll get a tasty cocktail on a chilly San Francisco night.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Stella Artois on tap, a pool table, a juke box, a sunny outdoor area.....and the phatest view in the city.

This is the best kept secret in SF.

Shhhhh...don't tell.
author: michelle d.

description: After a day of playing soccer, our team tries to head here after games.  They do have a fantastic view, but it's really too bad that you can't access the back patio on a nice day (I think it's because they don't have a permit).
author: Dana D.

description: I'd give this bar zero stars if I could. Blooms has got to be the worst bar experience I have ever had. The bartender is a complete and total jerk--not one redeeming quality to him whatsoever. I will never step in to that rat hole again.
author: Dottravis O.

description:
Hey Jason L. (see review below).....get over yourself...Bloom's is an absolute classic SF bar. No pretentions, no bulls**t. 
It is one of - if not the - best bars in the city. Dive bar with a fantastic view, perfect bartenders, and a classic look...please - you and See Bee C need to go somewhere else and avoid Bloom's at all cost...
Everyone else comes here to drink, laugh, act weird, get crazy, watch the games, play pool, darts, and everything else that a real bar is made for...!!
author: SF R.

description:
Comfortable neighborhood bar.  Good view.  Pretty much what everyone said below.  Yep, yep, yeah, that too.

The have a pool table, but it is one of those smaller sizes ones.  Even though I suck at pool, I still hate the smaller size table.
author: Ken and Yuri Q.

description: This is a great neighborhood place, it's never crowded, always chill. The barkeep is hilarious and the drinks are the right price.
author: Jorge H.

description:
Went here for the first time last weekend, and while the boy wasn't too impressed, I enjoyed myself.  As everyone else has said, it's a dive.  With great views.  And a great juke box.  I can see how the bartender might rub some people the wrong way, but well, I'm not one of those people.  I guess I was charmed by how proud he is of his daughter (Aubrey from Danity Kane).  

PS -- Don't let the jukebox sit empty or you'll hear one DK song after another, after another...
author: Dawn J.

description:
I was at this bar with Thaddeus and Amil a few days before I moved to Vegas back in Feb. 05. That was the last time I was there. I was back in town a few months ago and met my attorney at his Portrero office. We decided to pop into Blooms for a cold one or 12. Lo and behold I walk in and there is Thaddeus and Amil sitting in the same spot like they had never left.
Good Times, lots of bourbon soaked tales of Vegas strip clubs, nightclubs and various shenanigans involving midgets and fire engines and of course strippers. Oh hell I'll give Blooms four stars for pouring mean shots.
author: Bill H.

description:
I was passing the street, I hear a good music and people laughing from a bar. Usually I don't go to local bars where I don't know because they are not welcome to strangers. but this time I was curious to check out this lovely old style Potrero hill bar so I went inside to check it out for later on.
The bartender was very professional and didn't let me leave the bar thirsty. He asked me to join him and the other guy who was drinking with him at the bar. He gave me a shot and asked me what I wanted to drink. what ever you recommend I answered. He started me  with a shot of Irish whiskey and then gave me a pint of  Anchor!
That was great: great bartender, sunny SF, san franciscan beer and great old music at the time I did'nt intend to drink!
one more, two mores! I was getting tipsy with an empty stomach. 
The music, ambiance and decoration was great. 
The bartender who made my day ( Marak )  was very friendly with a great sense of humor,
Try this place as soon as you can if you are looking for an authentic local PUB!
author: Mahyar M.

description: This place is not pretentous, it is what it is ~ a classic dive bar with a world class view. The only downside is the closed patio which is such a tease because sitting out there on a Sunday with a bloody mary would be ~ something special!
author: Paul F.

description: Farley's doesn't have beer and Bloom's has the view.  Rico, Mark is the bartender to make me want to come back.
author: Steve J.

description:
All the typical characteristics of a neighborhood bar: cash only, rough owner, unmistakable fragrance. 

New to the neighborhood, I thought this would be a good place to watch a Bears game with my friend visiting from Chicago. They talk about the view of downtown from this place being great. Unfortunately I was treated to a different view, that of a harry white ass that mooned another guy at the bar for flirting with his girl. I think this should automatically disqualify this place for anything over 3 stars, and that's being nice since I really want to like this place for the sake of Potrero Hill.

I'll come back next '9ers season and give it another chance.
author: C P.

description: A nice neighborhood bar.  Good, strong drinks, mixed properly,  Nice laid back atmosphere at the pool table and for the bar in general.  Never seems overly crowded.  I don't always drink in a bar in Potrero Hill, but when I do I prefer Blooms.
author: Alured P.

description: Relevant for review: Cool place. Low key, cheap drinks, nice view
author: Tuhin S.

description:
good beer, great darts, excellent music, laid back and friendly clientele....Seriously, do you really need anything else? 
Standard dive and sooooo good. Went after a great meal at Chez Papa and even though not in my hood...I will be back :)
note: try the stella on tap. delicious.
author: Heather P.

description: Great chill place for a beer. Awesome bartenders, with a pool table and dart board and a great view when there is not fog.
author: Kendra R.

description: They don't call it BWP (Bar Without Pity) for nothing you whiny little monkeys!  It clearly states on the cash register drawer "No Sniveling".  Get over it euro-white scooter trash!  And this is just how the girls inside the doors talk ....
author: PHill G.

description: Best view in the city for a bar, casual, decent pool table and darts, area is a little dead and takes forever to get a cab. OK selection of beers.
author: Eric R.

description: I randomly landed in here one Sunday after brunch and ended up drinking some oat sodas and watching football. Blooms embodies the definition of a neighborhood bar. We seriously might as well had a sign that said 'Not Regulars' and carried it around. I am not deterred by surly attitudes or bartenders that casually ignore your money on the bar. I like bars with a little attitude. Oh, and hot dogs I'm too scared to try.
author: Michael E.

description: This place has the right amount of people (not too crowded, but not empty).  Great view of the city, friendly service.  A really nice spot to have a beer and catch up with a friend.  Pool table and darks, a juke-box that occasionally plays some classic hits that make all the drunk folks sing at the top of their lungs.  When this happens, you and your friend will realize there is no talking over it, and give in and sing at the top of your lungs, too.  Which is actually kind of fun.  Then you can get back to your chat.
author: Lanie W.

description: Went there after the Giants game and watched the fireworks from out back.  Great little dive bar and may make it a post game water hole.
author: Rob L.

description: Besides the view, and the low-key vibe, there's also a pretty good martini to be had here.  And what's not to like about that.  I don't drink too much in my neighborhood (though Dogpatch is drawing me back), but Bloom's is good.  And there's a detective agency on top.
author: Laurel B.

description: Excellent service, great atmosphere, nice patrons. There were also plenty of televisions to enjoy all the games playing. They also had pool, darts, a jukebox, and a small arcade for people to enjoy.
author: William M.

description:
Relatively clean for a dive bar, but the bartender is an unstable person. I ordered a beer, took a sip, found that it smelled like year-old butter. I asked for another one (politely, mind you) and he got highly agitated, aggressive, and generally acted like a jerk. 

In fairness to him, he did give me another beer, but his attitude left me vowing to never return.  Avoid if possible.
author: Hank K.

description: This place has a great view of the city, and it is a dive, but it's quiet there is always somewhere to sit, drinks a decent price, and they have a pool table. all in all I think this place is great to drink, play pool , or jusy stare out at the city
author: JIll H.

description: Love this little dive bar. Been coming here for yrs and they are always really friendly. Yeah sometimes certain bartenders can be a little jerkish but overall they are good ppl.
author: Michael W.

description: Great local bar. Strong drinks and a fun place to watch baseball. I come here fairly often and it is always a friendly place to have a few with some friends
author: mark h.

description: This is a pretty decent bar for relaxing after a long day of work in the potrero hill area. The bar is pretty well stocked. Few beers on stock but guiness and fat tire make it fine. As everyone else note, the juke box is good, the view is amazing. Pool table is cool too. Not a flashy place but fun and laid back.
author: Christopher R.

description: Blooms is a great little dive, with a beautiful view of the city. The juke box is full of good tunes. Small pool table and dart board. You have a handful of great restaurants nearby that you can get to go food and eat at at the bar with your favourite cocktail. More times than not, there is fresh FREE pizza from Goat Hill Pizza sitting on the bar for customers to munch on. Its cheap, intimate in the back and staff is friendly. A great Potrero Hill spot.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Solid three stars for being a clean bar with a great view of the city. Guessing this place hasn't changed much in 30 years, which is a big part of the charm. 

I'm big on bathrooms, and Bloom's is very clean for a dive. It does't really have much atmosphere though, and it's always REALLY COLD in there, which sort contributes to a slightly sad vibe. The crowd is generally 50+ and the music, as a previous poster stated, is frequently dusty. It's really the only game in town, as far as Potrero goes.
author: Gym W.

description:
After unsuccessfully trying to get into a sold-out show at the Bottom of the Hill, we decided to make good use of our time in Potrero by heading over to Bloom's. They have darts, pool, dice - what more could you possibly want in a local neighborhood bar? A nice bartender always helps.

Gene the bartender was hilarious and gave me shit for ordering a Captain & Diet Coke (he said what was the point of the diet soda, I said it saved 100 calories so I could drink guilt-free). He didn't see it that way but still served me with a smile and a very hearty laugh. Later in the night when I had to wait 2 minutes to order drinks, Gene apologized for making me wait so long and comped our round. Nice way to make a good impression, buddy!

My friend was asking fellow patrons for some life advice and Gene had 2 suggestions: "Keep your nose clean and don't f*ck up." I'll keep that in mind.
author: Cher E.

description: I had a business associate in town recently who wanted to have a beer and catch a view of the City.  Blooms did just that!  It is a dive bar, but really has a wonderful, underated, view of the City.  Friendly staff, good jukebox, cold beer, view...what else do you need?
author: Todd S.

description:
ya know, i actually really like blooms.

at first i thought this place was super shady and would only go to lingba or conn. yankee, but when i went in i realized what i was missing.

great setup for a chill bar - the bartender was the man, comping me a beer and overall being choice. patio out back, pool table, good beer on tap.

why the hell not go to blooms. jeez.
author: David D.

description: Schweet dive bar.  The bartenders are ALWAYS cool.  The dart board is KEY.  Bring your own food (order from goat hil pizza down the street), grab a beer, and throw some darts while watching the current sports game with your pals.
author: peter k.

description: Wow, new to the neighborhood, and was fired up to see a dive bar right near my house. What a disappointment. The owner/bartender was such a jerk that there is no way I could possibly go back. Without going into too much detail, I'll just let you know that he insulted the two of us without any sort of reason or provocation. Perhaps it was the fact that he himself was loaded, but still, that doesn't give him license to ill like that.
author: OperationWayne r.

description: View is cool, but unsure on crowd - but that being said it was a Saturday afternoon.  Felt very out of place not being a regular but that's probably the case most places at 3pm.  Need to give it a second chance.
author: Nate H.

description: great views but the bartender is the biggest a-hole ever. we were in there maybe 2 minutes when he yelled at us saying 'no hanging out - you need to order something'
author: Jon N.

description: Like many reviewers have pointed out, its definitely a neighborhood bar. The owner Rico is rough on the edges but a cool guy. But he does not come to the bar often and has left it to other bartenders like Nigel, who is rough on the edges but unlike Rico, is stupid and arrogant.
author: ram a.

description: Everyone needs a dive bar next to their laundromat. Say no more. I want it, I got it! Besides convenience, Bloom's has got a quintessential dive vibe and sweet views of downtown out the back window. So even sans clothing that really needs some sudsy love, it totally makes sense to stop in and get yoself some sudsy love.
author: Matt B.
